Tables and Lookup Tables¶

Modules used for defining Lookup Tables and Config Enums used for Config Padding mechanism are defined in this Module.

Use Table for lookup input are exactly the row number of the table, else use LookupTable.

Index Tables¶

class Table(name: str, table: torch.Tensor, n_col: int = None, *, pad_value: float = 0, pad_mode=0)[source]¶

Defines a Table of parameters of an insurance contract or an assumption with padding mechanism supported throw pad_mode and pad_value.

\[\text{out}_{i, j} = \text{table}_{\text{index}_i, j}\]

instances will be kept in a WeakValueDict, with their names as keys.

All Table are inherited from this class.

Attributes:
  • name (str)
    the name of Table, used as the key in the storage WeakValueDict.
  • table (Tensor)
    the table will be indexed, the dim of the table should be not more than 2. Padding can be used for long tedious table.
  • n_col (Optional[int])
    if None(default), then no padding will be act on the input table, if provided the n_col is the total column number of the table after padding.
  • raw_table (Parameter)
    the raw table before padding
Inputs:
  • index (Tensor)
    index for index select
Shape:
  • index: 1-D
__init__(name: str, table: torch.Tensor, n_col: int = None, *, pad_value: float = 0, pad_mode=0)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • name (str) – the name of Table
  • table (Tensor) – raw table
  • n_col (int) – if None(default), then no padding will be act on the input table, if provided the n_col is the total column number of the table after padding.
  • pad_value (float) – value needed for the pad_mode to work, for example pad_value is the valued filled if pad_mode=PadMode.Constant.
  • PadMode] pad_mode (Union[int,) – how to perform the padding, Constant padding by default.
class AgeIndexedTable(name: str, table: torch.Tensor, n_col: int = None, *, pad_value: float = 0, pad_mode=0)[source]¶

Table with issue age as index the result after benefit term is set to 0.

Inputs:
  • mp_idx (Tensor)

Lookup Tables¶

class LookupTable(name: str, table: torch.Tensor, n_col: int = None, *, index_col_num: int = 1, index_table=None, pad_value: float = 0, pad_mode=0)[source]¶

Defines a LookupTable of parameters of an insurance contract or an assumption with padding mechanism supported throw pad_mode and pad_value,

First the input is converted into row number bu ‘looking up’ in`index_table` then the rows are selected in table is not the row number of table.

\[\text{out}_{i, j} = \text{table}_{\text{index_table}[\text{lookup}], \; j} \]

instances will be kept in a WeakValueDict, with their names as keys.

All Table are inherited from this class.

Attributes:
  • name (str)
    the name of Table, used as the key in the storage WeakValueDict.
  • table (Tensor)
    the table will be indexed, the dim of the table should be not more than 2. Padding can be used for long tedious table.
  • index_table
    table storage the row index of lookup value
  • n_col (Optional[int])
    if None(default), then no padding will be act on the input table, if provided the n_col is the total column number of the table after padding.
  • raw_table (Parameter)
    the raw table before padding
  • raw_index_table (SparseTensor)
    sparse version of index_table
Inputs:
  • lookup (Tensor): lookup value for index select
Shape:
  • index: dim >= 1
__init__(name: str, table: torch.Tensor, n_col: int = None, *, index_col_num: int = 1, index_table=None, pad_value: float = 0, pad_mode=0)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • name (str) – the name of Table, used as the key in the storage WeakValueDict.
  • table (Tensor) – the table will be indexed, the dim of the table should be not more than 2. Padding can be used for long tedious table.
  • n_col (int) – if None(default), then no padding will be act on the input table, if provided the n_col is the total column number of the table after padding.
  • index_col_num (int) – if index_table is omitted, the first index_col_num columns of table are selected as index_table
  • index_table (Tensor) – table used to be convert input to row numbers. if omitted then index_col_num is used
  • pad_value (float) – value needed for the pad_mode to work, for example pad_value is the valued filled if pad_mode=PadMode.Constant.
  • PadMode] pad_mode (Union[int,) – how to perform the padding, Constant padding by default.
class PmtLookupTable(name: str, table: torch.Tensor, n_col: int = None, *, index_col_num: int = 1, index_table=None, pad_value: float = 0, pad_mode=0)[source]¶

LookupTable with payment term as the lookup key the result after benefit term is set to 0.

Inputs:
  • mp_idx (Tensor)
class PmtAgeLookupTable(name: str, table: torch.Tensor, n_col: int = None, *, index_col_num: int = 1, index_table=None, pad_value: float = 0, pad_mode=0)[source]¶

LookupTable with payment term and issue age as the lookup key the result after benefit term is set to 0.

Inputs:
  • mp_idx (Tensor)
